com.bfg.customer
Class Address

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bfg.customer.Address
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class Address
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Implements the address portion of a customer or credit card record. Both the Customer, Order and CreditCard object use this class to store address-specific information, which reduces the amount of redundant code.

Copyright 2002, James M. Turner No warranty is made as to the fitness of this code for any particular purpose. It is included for demonstration purposes only.

Author:
James M. Turner

getAddressID

public int getAddressID()
Returns the unique Address ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each address record.
Returns:
the address ID

setAddressID

public void setAddressID(int id)
Sets the unique Address ID, which is an autoincrementing database column used to uniquely identify each address record. Note that in normal usage, this should not be used because IDs are assigned by the database.
Parameters:
id - the address ID

findAddress

public static Address findAddress(int ID)
                           throws CustomerActivityException
Given an address ID, returns a new Address object populated from the database, or null if no such address exists.
Parameters:
ID - The unique ID of the address in the database
Returns:
A populated Address object, or null if none found.
Throws:
CustomeryActivityException - Thrown on database errors

                   throws CustomerActivityException
Creates a new address in the database and sets the address ID of the object to the newly created record's ID
